greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows: row n is the inverse binomial transform of the n-th row of array A255961, which has the Euler transform of (j->j*k) in column k.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
formula: G.f. of column k: (-1 + Product_{j>=1} 1 / (1 - x^j)^j)^k.
maple: A:= proc(n, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, k*add(
T:= (n, k)-> add(A(n, k-i)*(-1)^i*binomial(k, i), i=0..k):
mathematica: A[n_, k_] := A[n, k] = If[n==0, 1, k*Sum[A[n-j, k]*DivisorSigma[2, j], {j, 1, n}]/n];
T[n_, k_] := Sum[A[n, k-i]*(-1)^i*Binomial[k, i], {i, 0, k}];
Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 12}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 21 2017, translated from Maple *)
xref: Main diagonal and lower diagonals give: A000012, A008585, A081266.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, May 03 2015
